etymologies: late 16th century (denoting a light, fast boat which was rowed or sailed): from French frégate, from Italian fregata, of unknown origin

definitions: a warship with a mixed armament, generally heavier than a destroyer (in the US Navy) and of a kind originally introduced for convoy escort work.
shortDefinitions: warship with mixed armament, generally lighter than destroyer in US navy

definitions: a sailing warship of a size and armament just below that of a ship of the line.
shortDefinitions: sailing warship of size and armament just below that of ship of line
